1494-1519: Move to the Russian court for Mosalsk
Triggered (triggered event, 1441-1443): Union of the Churches for Mosalsk

480001. Move to the Russian court

Mosalsk — Not random

Conditions

  • Russia exists

Will happen within 360 days of January 1, 1494
Checked again every 360 days until trigger is met (cannot happen after December 30, 1519)

Description

The Vierchovian princedoms emerged after the death of Prince Mykhailo Vsevolodovych of Chernihiv. Some of them were in Lithuanian service, and some were in Moscow's service. Ivan III's success in uniting Rus' prompted some princes to move to his court along with their own lands. Disobedient princedoms were ravaged for several years until the Russians occupied the whole region in 1494.

Actions

A. Accept Russian protection

  • -100 relations with Lithuania
  • +100 relations with Russia
  • Break vassalization with -1

B. Our land is Russian (End Game)

C. Be loyal to Lithuania

  • +100 relations with Lithuania
  • -100 relations with Russia

Back to top

480000. Union of the Churches

Mosalsk — Not random

Triggered by

Action A of 233019 - Union with the Latins? for Moscow
Action B of 40093 - Metropolitan Isidore Accepts the Council of Florence for Moscow

Description

Rus' was baptised in 988, when Christianity was unified. After centuries of schism, the church of northeastern Rus' returned to the true faith, recognising the supremacy of the Metropolitan Isidore of Kyiv. A new reality had arrived.

Actions

A. Let's rejoice for the reunited Church!

  • Stability -3
  • Change religion to catholic
  • +100 relations with Papal States
  • +100 relations with Lithuania
  • +50 relations with Byzantium
  • +50 relations with Moscow
  • Religion in the capital province changes to catholic
  • Global revolt risk +8 for 60 months
  • A random province revolts
  • A random province revolts

B. Orthodoxy will never die!

  • Stability +1
  • -100 relations with Papal States
  • -100 relations with Lithuania
  • -100 relations with Byzantium
  • -100 relations with Moscow
